website_summaries.verdict: Though it's a little expensive for its feature set, the Sony 8-inch Digital Photo Frame DPF-D80 delivers exactly what most people want: high-quality photo slideshows in an easy-to-use, attractive package.

customer_reviews.title: Great digital photo frame
customer_reviews.text: This is a review for the 8" Sony DPF-D82 digital photo frame. The frame looks good, is well designed, very easy to use. The photos look great. I loaded the pictures on a Kigston SD6/4GB SDHC memory card, plugged it in the unit, and the frame operated flawlessly. You can display the photos a number of different ways, controlled by a remote. A bit more expensive than some of the competition, but worth it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Great Digital Frame
customer_reviews.text: I have been using it for so longtime now and definitely I do recommend this digital frame. There is timing option which will help you saving energy by sitting the start-up hour and shutdown hour. Have plenty of ports that will help you in displaying your photos in any way you want. Finally, supports different languages.
customer_reviews.author: Saif Al-Khuraisat

customer_reviews.title: Sony Digital Photo Frame
customer_reviews.text: We initially purchased this frame from Amazon for our daughter and her family as a gift. They did not care for the format of the frame and so we replaced it with a Kodak frame that was more square in shape and a more pleasing format for them. We kept the Sony frame for ourselves and like the picture quality very much. Great picture clarity.
customer_reviews.author: J. Sylvester

customer_reviews.title: It's Sony so no baloney!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Sony DPF-D82 after doing a bit of research on digital frames on the web. I am extremely pleased with the unit. It works as advertised and its functions are very well thought out. I especially like the combination calendar, clock and picture theme. It is well worth its purchase price and I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Stan Mattos

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Image Display
customer_reviews.text: The picture display is excellent, which I believe is the most important attribute when selecting a digital frame. It is the reason I selected this product, and I am fully satisfied. That said, the image is wide screen, which is the direction the newer digital cameras are going. I am displaying the 50 to 90 year old family photos that are in an album on a shelf. Slective croping was needed to match the pictures to the display. I would recommend this product to anyone in the market for a digital frame, but you should understand the charastics of this product and the pictures you expect to display.
customer_reviews.author: Gray Hair

customer_reviews.title: Simply doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: We've spent hours trying to get this thing to work --- about 1/3 of our pictures don't show. We've experimented with the edited pictures but, after just loading some recently taken pictures, that's not entirely it. Best I can surmise is that Sony, as usual, have put in some proprietary format that doesn't make it compatible with all format sizes. When the pictures do work, they show brilliantly. Unfortunately, like all consumer electronic manuals, they are written by the pharmaceutical companies. You get so frustrated after trying to decipher the gibberish, you need a valium or stronger afterwards. Tried to reach Sony -- after a week, no response. So, they will be returned.
customer_reviews.author: JF

customer_reviews.title: Sony DPF-D82 8-Inch LCD WVGA 15:9 Diagonal Digital Photo Frame
customer_reviews.text: Great Product, easy to set up, and very sleek looking. It also has a clock when not being used for photo display, and when on the clock feature, makes a great night light. I'd highly recommend this one.
customer_reviews.author: MAC

customer_reviews.title: Review
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking, easy to operate and well performing video frame. I can not find any faults with it. Price was right. I'm satisfied with it, but plan to purchase a larger frame.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sony Digital Photo Frame Delivers
customer_reviews.text: The digital photo frame is easy to operate right out of the box. It has good flexibility as to types of input storage cards that it can use. The photo frame has nice options for how the display is shown. It has been running for quite some time without problems.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie G

customer_reviews.title: excellent
customer_reviews.text: got my item exactly as advertised. took about 18 days to ship from USA to Canada under normal shipping. when i opened the package, only then I realized the packaging was superb. throughly cushioned inside, while the middle is the original box. the photo frame has no scratches at all. none of the items seem to be refurbished/used. would gladly deal with again!
customer_reviews.author: Blackhog

customer_reviews.title: Nice picture frame
customer_reviews.text: Nice picture frame, controls could be easier, and the cord is a little bit of a pain, but it needs to get power from somewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew S. Kuzmich

customer_reviews.title: Sony DPF-D82 8 Inch LCD Frame
customer_reviews.text: I bought this frame for my husband. I had to set it up, then he got hooked and immediately loaded photos. The only issue was the frame did not accomodate the card from our digital camera, he had to use the photos from the jump drive. And the frame has to be plugged into an outlet. A battery option would be a good feature.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Casey

customer_reviews.title: Great product, silly manual
customer_reviews.text: Looks great and you can turn off the overbearing Sony light so the whole frame is just black. Impressed as it resizes large photos for you and gives you the choice to fill the frame (which is 16:9) or leave the photos as is. Photos look great. However, I found the manual to be hard to understand in regard to importing to the internal menu...you get there in the end...but it's so Sony in that special Japanese way.
customer_reviews.author: C. D. Albert

customer_reviews.title: Sony DPF-D82 8 inch
customer_reviews.text: The images are really stunning on this digital photo frame. I don't like how some of my pictures cannot be rotated or enlarged once displayed on the frame. I love the automatic shut off restart feature!
customer_reviews.author: Maritza C. Flores

customer_reviews.title: Looks great on my desk.
customer_reviews.text: The pictures look great and I like the transitions. When not enjoying the pix, the clock is great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this digital picture frame. The pictures are very clear and easy to see. Set up was easy as well.
customer_reviews.author: Sue

customer_reviews.title: Best Digital Frame
customer_reviews.text: Great product, easy to use, excellent quality, build in calendar and alarm clock. Excellent gift!
customer_reviews.author: M. Fedotova

customer_reviews.title: picture quality was a surprise
customer_reviews.text: I thought the picture quality would be a lot higher. I guess the images that looked great on my computer monitor, didn't quite "shine" on this frame. They were even a bit too light, and some of the tones seemed to wash out. I returned it, and am trying another frame that has slightly higher resolution.
customer_reviews.author: Mary S. Christianson

customer_reviews.title: Edited Photos
customer_reviews.text: For those having trouble displaying edited photos, in what format does your editing software save the edited images? I use Photoshop Elements (PSE) and for some edits, it saves in a PSE format, which confuses many other programs (uploading to Snapfish, etc. also). These I convert to JPEG, which I can do on the editing screen of Photoshop Elements, and then save as JPEG, which are more readily usable. I hope this helps someone else.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Like it
customer_reviews.text: Nice quality look to both photos and frame. There are a few photos that won't show or come up fuzzy, probably because they were formatted differently, but I will just remove them from my flash drive before trying to store to internal memory. Looked at some cheaper options locally, but am so glad I went with this one. Looks so much nicer and so far seems to be working great, and easy to use. Even reformatted some old negatives into jpg and they look good too.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It won't handle edited photos
customer_reviews.text: Holy cow. I edit nearly all my photos on my Mac using iPhoto and this stinkin' digital frame won't display them. What a piece of crap. Who doesn't edit their photos? Are you kidding' me? I'm taking this back and getting something else. (Thanks Sony for getting me all peeved. Poor husband got me this as a Christmas gift and it's going back. He feels bad. I just feel mad. Shame on you, Sony. How backwards can you be?)
customer_reviews.author: Lisa B

customer_reviews.title: 80% of My MAC & Edited Pictures Won't Upload
customer_reviews.text: What horrible piece of machinery. I spent 2 hours transferring years worth of photos to a memory stick only to find out that they won't display. It's just showing a squiggly line. Apparently, from other reviews, since I have a MAC and I edit most of my photos, that's a double whammy for disaster!!! Grrr I wish I read the reviews before I purchased this as on a whim for a mother's day present! DO NOT BUY IF YOU HAVE A MAC AND/OR EDIT YOUR PHOTOS.
customer_reviews.author: A. Warren

customer_reviews.title: [Solved] Doesn't show pictures from memory card
customer_reviews.text: After buying two of these frames, I was getting frustrated with the frame not recognizing the pictures on the memory card. There's a solution. I put it on my site. Just go to swimminginthought.com and search for s-frame.
customer_reviews.author: Percy Kwong

customer_reviews.title: Good one
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice digital frame, with one exception: when it auto-turns off, the clock does not show. Is anyone able to figure out how to set the time so that it shifts from slideshow to clock at night and back in the morning ? Regards, Arjun
customer_reviews.author: Arjun96

customer_reviews.title: Excellent digital photo frame
customer_reviews.text: After looking for a Valentine's gift, I bought this frame for my wife and she's very satisfied, all pictures, edited or not run without problems.
customer_reviews.author: F. Galvez

customer_reviews.title: Best digital frame so far
customer_reviews.text: This Sony digital frame is one of the best I've bought. But it's bigger brother (10") is the one I just love. It's expensive but the most versatile and the bigger picture is outstanding.
customer_reviews.author: Panda205

product_meta.title: Sony DPF-D82 8-Inch LCD WVGA 15:9 Diagonal Digital Photo Frame (Black)
product_meta.description:
Get more entertainment from your photos with Sony's DPF-D82 Digital Photo Frame. Store up to 2000 images that you can display as single pictures, multiple thumbnails, search function to easily find images, or slideshow presentations. The 8-inch widescreen (15:9) LCD screen showcases your cherished memories in WVGA resolution (800 x 480) and vivid color, while an Auto Orientation sensor automatically rotates your photos into portrait or landscape format.

Direct USB input from most digital cameras and support for most memory cards makes it easy for virtually anyone to transfer photos and relive meaningful events. Clock and calendar display modes and an included remote control provide added convenience.
feature_bullets: Multi card slot (MS, SD, CF, and xD)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.5 out of 5 stars36 ratings3.5 out of 5 stars
